intro: Pulmonaria transsilvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of velvety, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, shady woodland habitats and is often found in forested areas with rich, well-drained soil. Pulmonaria transsilvanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
